attributes.action: To be reminded that as elected Members of Parliament, they should serve and reflect the wishes of the the people of this country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition is drawn up to remind the government and opposition parties that as elected Members of Parliament, they are expected to serve and reflect the wishes of the people of the United Kingdom. The Prime Minister must also publicly acknowledge that to not invite Her Majesty the Queen to the 65th Anniversary Commemoration of the D-Day Landings was a gross error of judgement. The vast majority of patriotic people in this country are appalled at the decision, and would remind Her Majesty's government (note the title) that no one person's ego should be allowed to get in the way of the express wishes of his electorate.

rejection.details: Your petition should be a clear call for action. Please reword and resubmit
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
